name: Avoid Methods and Functions with High Fan-In (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all the Functions and Methods with High Fan-In. The Fan-in of a Method or a Function is the number of other Artifacts that are referencing it. In the Fan-In of an Artifact, multiple accesses to it from the same Artifact are counted as one access. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
output:
This report lists all Methods and Functions with a High Fan-In.
This QR provides the following information:
Method and Function full name.
rationale: The higher the number of referenced Artifacts, the more difficult the maintenance and evolution is. The updates in referenced Artifacts will need to be tested and taken into account.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of Methods and Functions with a High Fan-In.
